intro: Hiraea ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hiraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features include a slender stem and aromatic foliage. Hiraea ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
